newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Ringgit market closed for New Year holiday.
newsitem.headline: Ringgit market closed for New Year holiday.

text.p: The foreign exchange market in Malaysia was closed on Wednesday for the New Year holiday.
The market will re-open on Thursday, when the ringgit was widely expected to trade in a range, dealers said.
They said ringgit was expected to track the movements of the U.S. dollar against other major currencies in the first few days of the new year.
On Tuesday, the ringgit closed at 2.5250 a dollar against a range of 2.5267/5310 on Monday.
